ovdesc.p: Authorization Principle table defines the levels of Authorization (or the number of ‘eyes’) that a manually processed payment (through Order Entry
or repair) or a cancelled warehouse payment would go through.

desc.p: Indicates the message type as received by the payments hub, for which this record is created.
Valid Values from 'MessagePaymentType' field in PPT.MSGPAYMENTTYPE table
Input is mandatory for this field.
Indicates the lower level of message priority for which this authorization principle record is created.The Message Priority of the payment should be equal or higher than this value.
Can be set to any values between 0 to 9.
Input is mandatory for this field
Indicates channel of payment origination for which this authorization principle record is created.
Valid Values from 'Source' field in PPT.SOURCE table
Input is mandatory for this field.
Indicates the company ID for which the record is created.
The value links to the field ‘CompanyID’ in PPT.COMPANY
Record Activation Code generated for the record by the payment's hub.

Specifies the order (sequence) of the record in the application. Based on the value, a record is prioritised in such a way that, it is given higher preference for selection under peeling logic applied in the payments hub.
Record Status Code generated for the record by the payments hub.
Specifies the date from which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.
Indicates Status of the payment for which this authorization principle record is created.
Input is mandatory for this field.Value links to field, 'StatusCode' in PPT.STATUSCODE table
Indicates the lower limit of transaction amount for which this authorization principle record is created.The Transaction Amount of the payment should be equal or higher than this value.
Accepts non negative amount values upto 17 digits including decimals.
Input is mandatory for this field.
Indicates the Upper limit of transaction amount for which this authorization principle record is created.The Transaction Amount of the payment should be equal or lower than this value.
Accepts non negative amount values upto 17 digits including decimals.
Input is mandatory for this field
Input is mandatory for this field
Indicates transaction currency of the payment for which this authorization principle record is created.
Input is mandatory for this field.Value links to field, 'CurrencyCode' in PPT.CURRENCY table
Indicates the Upper level of message priority for which this authorization principle record is created.The Message Priority of the payment should be equal or lower than this value.
Input is mandatory for this field.Can be set to any values between 0 to 9.
Holds the number of Authorizations required for a
payment. Can be set to any values between 1 to 5.
A payment that needs 1 level of Authorization would go through 4 eye principle. A payment with 2 level of Authorization would go through 6 eye principle.
Input is mandatory for this field.
Holds business line of the Credit Customer for which this authorization principle record is created.This field can hold upto 3 alpha characters.Default Value is '*'
Input is mandatory for this field.
Holds the payment message transfer type for which this authorization principle record is created.
Input is mandatory for this field.
Holds business line of the Debit Customer for which this authorization principle record is created.
Input is mandatory for this field.This field can hold upto 3 alpha characters.Default Value is '*'
Holds the direction of the payment message for which this authorization principle record is created.
Input is mandatory for this field.
Specifies the date until which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.Post this date, the record will be set as Inactive by the payments hub.
Input is mandatory for this field.
Indicates Weight Code of the payment message for which this authorization principle record is created.
Input is mandatory for this field.
